Package pt.pa.view

Class TransportMap

java.lang.Object
pt.pa.view.TransportMap
public class TransportMap extends Object
Represents a transport map that manages stops and routes using a graph structure. This class is responsible for loading transport data from JSON files, constructing the graph, and providing access to its elements.

    • TransportMap

      public TransportMap()

  • Method Details

    • jsonImporter

      public void jsonImporter()
      Imports stops and routes from JSON files and constructs the graph representation. This method reads stops, inserts them as vertices, then reads routes and connects the stops with edges.

    • loadStops

      public List<Stops> loadStops(String filePath)
      Loads stop data from a JSON file and returns a list of Stops objects.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the stops JSON file.
      Returns:
      A list of Stops objects.

    • loadRoutes

      public List<Routes> loadRoutes(String filePath)
      Loads route data from a JSON file and returns a list of Routes objects.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the routes JSON file.
      Returns:
      A list of Routes objects.

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile()
      Saves the graph to JSON files for stops and routes.

    • loadFromFile

      public void loadFromFile()

    • loadMapGraph

      public com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graph.Graph<Stops,Routes> loadMapGraph()
      Returns:
      The graph containing stops as vertices and routes as edges.

    • getRoute

      public Routes getRoute(String startCode, String endCode)

    • getStop

      public Stops getStop(String code)

    • numberOfStops

      public void numberOfStops(Label labelTotalStops, Label labelIsolatedStops, Label labelNonIsolatedStops, Label labelUserCreatedStops)
      Calculates and displays the number of total stops, isolated stops, non-isolated stops, and user-created stops within the transport map.
      Parameters:
      labelTotalStops - Label to display the total number of stops.
      labelIsolatedStops - Label to display the number of isolated stops (no connections).
      labelNonIsolatedStops - Label to display the number of non-isolated stops (connected to routes).
      labelUserCreatedStops - Label to display the number of user-added stops.

    • numberOfRoutes

      public void numberOfRoutes(Label labelTotalRoutes, Label labelTrainRoutes, Label labelBusRoutes, Label labelBoatRoutes, Label labelWalkRoutes, Label labelBicycleRoutes, Label labelPossibleRoutes)
      Computes and displays statistics regarding the number of transport routes by type, including train, bus, boat, walking, and bicycle routes.
      Parameters:
      labelTotalRoutes - Label to display the total number of routes.
      labelTrainRoutes - Label to display the number of train routes.
      labelBusRoutes - Label to display the number of bus routes.
      labelBoatRoutes - Label to display the number of boat routes.
      labelWalkRoutes - Label to display the number of walking routes.
      labelBicycleRoutes - Label to display the number of bicycle routes.
      labelPossibleRoutes - Label to display the total possible transport routes.

    • findStopsAccessibleByAllModes

      public List<Stops> findStopsAccessibleByAllModes()
      Finds all stops that are accessible by all modes of transportation. A stop is considered accessible if it has a valid route for at least one form of transportation: train, bus, boat, walk, or bicycle.
      Returns:
      a list of stops that are accessible by all modes of transportation.

    • findLongestTrainRoute

      public Routes findLongestTrainRoute()
      Finds the longest route accessible by train. This method iterates through all the edges in the map and identifies the route with the longest distance for the train mode.
      Returns:
      the route with the longest distance for the train mode, or null if no such route exists.

    • findLongestBusRoute

      public Routes findLongestBusRoute()
      Finds the longest route accessible by bus. This method iterates through all the edges in the map and identifies the route with the longest distance for the bus mode.
      Returns:
      the route with the longest distance for the bus mode, or null if no such route exists.

    • findLongestWalkingRoute

      public Routes findLongestWalkingRoute()
      Finds the longest walking route. This method iterates through all the edges in the map and identifies the route with the longest distance for walking.
      Returns:
      the route with the longest distance for walking, or null if no such route exists.

    • findShortestPath

      public List<Stops> findShortestPath(String startCode, String endCode, String optimizationCriteria, List<String> transportModes)
      Finds the shortest path between two stops based on the provided optimization criteria and allowed transport modes. This method uses a modified version of the Bellman-Ford algorithm to find the shortest path between a start and end stop. The path is optimized based on criteria such as distance, duration, or sustainability, and considers the allowed modes of transport.
      Parameters:
      startCode - The code of the starting stop.
      endCode - The code of the destination stop.
      optimizationCriteria - The criterion to optimize the path, such as "distance", "duration", or "sustainability".
      transportModes - A list of transport modes allowed for the path (e.g., "train", "bus", "walk", etc.).
      Returns:
      a list of stops representing the shortest path from start to end, or an empty list if no valid path is found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either the start or end stop code is invalid.
      IllegalStateException - if the graph contains a negative weight cycle.

    • createNewStop

      public void createNewStop(String stopCode, String stopName, Double latitude, Double longitude)
      Creates a new stop with the specified details and adds it to the graph. The stop is marked as user-created and is inserted as a new vertex in the map.
      Parameters:
      stopCode - The code of the stop to be created.
      stopName - The name of the stop to be created.
      latitude - The latitude of the stop.
      longitude - The longitude of the stop.

    • removeStop

      public void removeStop(String stopCode)
      Removes an existing stop from the graph. The stop can only be removed if it was created by the user. Incident edges associated with the stop are also removed.
      Parameters:
      stopCode - The code of the stop to be removed.

    • createNewRoute

      public void createNewRoute(String stopCodeStart, String stopCodeEnd, Double distanceWalk, Double durationWalk, Double costWalk)
      Creates a new route or updates an existing route between two stops with the specified walking details. If a route already exists between the stops, the walking details are added or updated. Otherwise, a new walking route is created.
      Parameters:
      stopCodeStart - The code of the start stop for the route.
      stopCodeEnd - The code of the end stop for the route.
      distanceWalk - The walking distance for the route.
      durationWalk - The walking duration for the route.
      costWalk - The walking cost for the route.

    • removeRoute

      public void removeRoute(String stopCodeStart, String stopCodeEnd)
      Removes a specific route from the graph, if it exists.
      Parameters:
      stopCodeStart - The code of the starting stop of the route.
      stopCodeEnd - The code of the ending stop of the route.

    • deactivateRoute

      public void deactivateRoute(String stopCodeStart, String stopCodeEnd, List<String> transportModes)
      Deactivates a specific route entirely or disables specific transport modes on it.
      Parameters:
      stopCodeStart - The code of the starting stop of the route.
      stopCodeEnd - The code of the ending stop of the route.
      transportModes - A list of transport modes to deactivate (optional). If null or empty, the entire route will be deactivated.

    • restoreRoute

      public void restoreRoute(String stopCodeStart, String stopCodeEnd, Routes previousRoute)
      Restores a route between two stops in the transport map using the previous state.
      Parameters:
      stopCodeStart - The starting stop code.
      stopCodeEnd - The ending stop code.
      previousRoute - The previous state of the route to be restored.
